# UISplitViewController.Style

**Enumeration**

Constants that describe the number of columns the split view interface displays.

## Declaration

```swift
enum Style
```

## Overview

In iOS 14 and later, [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController] supports column-style layouts. A column-style split view controller lets you create an interface with two or three columns by using [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController/init(style:)] with the appropriate [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController/style-swift.property]:

- Use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController/Style-swift.enum/doubleColumn] style to create a split view interface with a two-column layout. This style of split view controller manages two child view controllers, placed in the primary and secondary columns.
- Use the [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController/Style-swift.enum/tripleColumn] style to create a split view interface with a three-column layout. This style of split view controller manages three child view controllers, placed in the primary, supplementary, and secondary columns.



Before iOS 14, [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController] supported just one split view interface style with a primary view controller and a secondary view controller. This classic interface style applies to split view controllers created using any other approach than [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController/init(style:)]. Split view controllers with the classic interface have a [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController/style-swift.property] of [doc://com.apple.uikit/documentation/UIKit/UISplitViewController/Style-swift.enum/unspecified] and they don’t respond to any of the column-style APIs introduced in iOS 14 and later.

## Constants

- **UISplitViewController.Style.unspecified**: The split view interface uses the classic split view style.
- **UISplitViewController.Style.doubleColumn**: The split view interface displays two columns.
- **UISplitViewController.Style.tripleColumn**: The split view interface displays three columns.

## Initializers

- **init(rawValue:)**

## Getting the split view style

- **style**: The style that determines the number of columns that the split view interface displays.

## Conforms To

- BitwiseCopyable
- Equatable
- Hashable
- RawRepresentable
- Sendable
- SendableMetatype
